poem:
Title: The Transforming Stout

Among old men, the pint held sway,
now young women turn its way.
Dark stout whispers in tongues of ale,
revels in stories beyond the pale-
Seek not just stout in archaic veins,
but mingled in modernity's fiery lanes.
Ebb and flow of taste's grand motions,
drinks reshaped by youthful potions-
In every flavor, in every hour,
hidden lies the pale ale's power.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Higher stout consumption driven by female drinkers and low alcohol options Stout, sometimes thought of as the drink of older men in pubs, is finding a diverse audience – and it’s not just Guinness that’s boosting sales. The beer, part of the ale family and usually a very dark colour, is attracting a range of consumers, including young women, drawn in by new flavours and lower alcohol options. The consumption of stout globally, by volume,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
